Description: A Kent, Washington, hazardous waste management facility has agreed to pay the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency a $275,000 penalty for violating state and federal hazardous waste management laws. According to EPA, workers at Burlington Environmental caused two fires by mishandling hazardous waste and failing to comply with basic facility safety rules.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/c8264499b26650c08525795700653aab.html

Company: CLEAN EARTH OF SOUTHEAST PA LLC

Notes: Modified order allowing a proposal half the penalty be replaced with an Environmental Improvement Project with estimated cost of $19,000

Description: Amended Order supersedes original Order 2011-A-0016 which assessed a $12,750 penalty + $1,913 cost recovery. This Amended Order accepts half, $6,375, as monetary penalty + company's performance of EIP valued at minimum of $12,750 (tree planting project). Cost recovery remains the same.
